div1.p: The "Bulletin of the Medical Library Association" accepts Hench's papers on yellow fever for publication.

div1.head: Letter from Henry R. Viets to Philip Showalter Hench, February 24, 1941
div1.opener:

HENRY R. VIETS, M.D.
Chairman
and Editor of the Bulletin
Boston Medical Library
JAMES F. HALLARD
Business Manager
Boston Medical Library
8 The Fenway, Boston
MISS MILDRED JORDAN
Medical School Library
Emory University, Ga.
MISS FRIDA PLIEFKE
Mayo Clinic, Library
Rochester, Minn.
NATHAN VAN PATTEN
Lane Medical Library
Stanford University

BULLETIN OF THE
MEDICAL LIBRARY ASSOCIATION
Founded 1902
Office of the Editor
8 THE FENWAY, BOSTON, MASS.
February 24, 1941
Dr. P. S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p: Thank you for your letter of February 18.

I should be very much interested in seeing
the four papers on yellow fever. If they are
all short, I see no reason why they should not
be published in the Bulletin. The type could
be saved and all four of the papers issued as one
reprint.

If you wish me to consider them for the
Bulletin this year, they must be in my hands by
the 15th of April; otherwise they will go over
to next Fall.
div1.closer:
Yours very truly, Henry R. Viets, M. D.
